author: Satoshi Nakamoto
content: Andreessen Horowitz, a venture capital firm, has led a $5 million seed round into Setter, a consumer app that enables brands to explore Web3-powered commerce. The New York-based app aims to assist brands in promoting exclusive products and offering customers limited edition drops. Setter intends to simplify the process of entering Web3 for users by tackling the complexities of current wallet technologies. CEO Juan Hernandez described the app as a "full-blown smart contract wallet" disguised as a Web2 app. The company's initial focus is on establishing partnerships with streetwear and sneaker brands, but they plan to expand into fashion, luxury items, and consumer collectibles. The seed round also received support from Marcy Ventures Partners, Superlayer, Thirty Five Ventures, and tennis legend Serena Williams.
title: A16z Supports Setter in $5M Seed Round.
